selected_quotes: Exposure to a youthful circulaton rejuvenates bone repair through modulation of -catenin
Exposure to a youthful circulation rejuvenates bone repair through modulation of β-catenin
Rejuvenating your blood speeds healing of broken bones, visit #aging #rejuvenation #antiaging
Exposure to a youthful circulation rejuvenates bone repair through modulation of β-catenin: #openaccess @NatureComms

citation.abstract: The capacity for tissues to repair and regenerate diminishes with age. We sought to determine the age-dependent contribution of native mesenchymal cells and circulating factors on in vivo bone repair. Here we show that exposure to youthful circulation by heterochronic parabiosis reverses the aged fracture repair phenotype and the diminished osteoblastic differentiation capacity of old animals. This rejuvenation effect is recapitulated by engraftment of young haematopoietic cells into old animals. During rejuvenation, β-catenin signalling, a pathway important in osteoblast differentiation, is modulated in the early repair process and required for rejuvenation of the aged phenotype. Temporal reduction of β-catenin signalling during early fracture repair improves bone healing in old mice. Our data indicate that young haematopoietic cells have the capacity to rejuvenate bone repair and this is mediated at least in part through β-catenin, raising the possibility that agents that modulate β-catenin can improve the pace or quality of fracture repair in the ageing population.
citation.title: Exposure to a youthful circulaton rejuvenates bone repair through modulation of [beta]-catenin

news.title: Don't Inject Yourself With Baby Mouse Blood Cells Just Yet
news.summary: You might be under the impression that young blood is the fountain of youth. A number of studies conducted in older mice (and, once, humans ) over the past 10 years have…

news.title: Vampire Healing: Young Blood Can Mend Old Broken Bones
news.summary: It's old blood, not old bones, that makes fracture healing difficult among the elderly

news.title: Young blood helps repair fractured bones of ageing mice
news.summary: Youthful blood has once again shown its promise as an elixir of youth – this time helping to rejuvenate bones. But exactly how it does so is still to be unravelled

news.title: Old bones can regain youthful healing power
news.summary: Broken bones in older people are notoriously slow to heal, but researchers at Duke Medicine have identified a potential way to speed the process.

facebook.title: Timeline Photos
facebook.summary:
Молодая кровь обладает особыми целебными свойствами, которые исчезают, когда мы становимся старше. 

Ученые долго считали, что сломанные кости заживают дольше в пожилом возрасте из-за костных клеток, которые ухудшаются с возрастом. Недавно исследователи об

年をとると骨折の治りが遅くなるのはだいたいの人が知っていると思います。
しかし、なぜ若い人に比べて治癒が遅くなるのかについては、完全に解明されていません。

今週のNature Communicationsに掲載されている論文では老齢マウスを骨折させ、若いマウスと血流をつないで治癒がどうなるか見ています。
その結果、治癒が促進したようです。
以前の研究でも、年齢によって骨を作る細胞の循環中の量が違うことが報告されており、血中の何らかの物質が骨折治癒に大きく関わっていることが示唆されています。
